page.title: 06Animals at Upper Lutheredge.
page.content: On the opposite side of the valley there used to be a mature larchwood. A 'tip' was made the other side of it. Since the trees have been felled the 'tip' is visible. The farmer also acts as a farm adviser to other farmers in the area and to some as far away as Scotland.He helps them increase the yield from their crops. On the farm they have{100}beef cattle,6 sheep and 5 horses.Four of these belong to people in the village of Nympsfield. He looks after the smallest{triplet {sheep}which are given to him by other farmers.The sheep on this farm are 'orphans'.When they are a year old they are slaughtered.Some of the meat is used by the farmer,being stored in a freezer until it is needed.
